org.apache.ambari.server.controller

Class AuthToLocalBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.ambari.server.controller.AuthToLocalBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable

    public class AuthToLocalBuilder
extends Object
implements Cloneable
    AuthToLocalBuilder helps to create auth_to_local rules for use in configuration files like core-site.xml. No duplicate rules will be generated.

    Allows previously existing rules to be added verbatim. Also allows new rules to be generated based on a principal and local username. For each principal added to the builder, generate a rule conforming to one of the following formats:

    Qualified Principal (the principal contains a user and host): RULE:[2:$1@$0](PRIMARY@REALM)s/.*\/LOCAL_USERNAME/

    Unqualified Principal (only user is specified): RULE:[1:$1@$0](PRIMARY@REALM)s/.*\/LOCAL_USERNAME/

    Additionally, for each realm included in the rule set, generate a default realm rule in the format: RULE:[1:$1@$0](.*@REALM)s/@.*//

    Ordering guarantees for the generated rule string are as follows:

    • Rules with the same expected component count are ordered according to match component count
    • Rules with different expected component count are ordered according to the default string ordering
    • Rules in the form of .*@REALM are ordered after all other rules with the same expected component count

                          boolean caseInsensitiveUserSupport)

        defaultRealm - a String declaring the default realm
        additionalRealms - a String containing a comma-delimited list of realm names to incorporate into the generated rule set
        caseInsensitiveUserSupport - true indicating that case-insensitivity should be enabled; false otherwise

      • addRules

        public AuthToLocalBuilder addRules(String authToLocalRules)
        Add existing rules from the given authToLocal configuration property. The rules are added verbatim.
        Parameters:
        authToLocalRules - config property value containing the existing rules

      • addRule

        public AuthToLocalBuilder addRule(String principal,
                                  String localUsername)
        Adds a rule for the given principal and local user. The principal must contain a realm component.

        The supplied principal is parsed to determine if it is qualified or unqualified and stored accordingly so that when the mapping rules are generated the appropriate rule is generated.

        If a principal is added that yields a duplicate primary principal value (relative to the set of qualified or unqualified rules), that later entry will overwrite the older entry, allowing for only one mapping rule.

        If the principal does not match one of the two expected patterns, it will be ignored.

        Parameters:
        principal - a string containing the full principal
        localUsername - a string declaring that local username to map the principal to
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the provided principal doesn't contain a realm element

      • generate

        public String generate()
        Generates the auth_to_local rules used by configuration settings such as core-site/auth_to_local.

        Each rule is concatenated using the default ConcatenationType, like calling generate(ConcatenationType) with DEFAULT_CONCATENATION_TYPE

        Returns:
        a string containing the generated auth-to-local rule set

      • generate

        public String generate(AuthToLocalBuilder.ConcatenationType concatenationType)
        Generates the auth_to_local rules used by configuration settings such as core-site/auth_to_local.

        Each rule is concatenated using the specified AuthToLocalBuilder.ConcatenationType. If the concatenation type is null, the default concatenation type is assumed - see DEFAULT_CONCATENATION_TYPE.

        Parameters:
        concatenationType - the concatenation type to use to generate the rule set string
        Returns:
        a string containing the generated auth-to-local rule set
